availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Metcalf (Lexington and Nicholasville rope and bagging manufacturer)

body.p: Lexington and Nicholasville, Kentucky rope and bagging manufacturer. Jessamine County, Kentucky native. Married Elizabeth Fishback Metcalf. Father of John Metcalf, Sarah J. Metcalf, Mary B. Metcalf, George W. Metcalf, Charles W. Metcalf, Alice P. Metcalf, Elizabeth Metcalf.

bibl.p: KYR-0001-020-0197. Bennett H. Young, A History of Jessamine County, Kentucky, From its Earliest Settlement to 1898 (Louisville, KY: Courier-Journal Job Printing Company, 1898), p. 242-243. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 74. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 119. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 6. “Henry Metcalf,” Find A Grave, March 31, 2013, Memorial no. 107594565.
